Under ____ system, provincial ____ are ____ for ____ operating ____ of ____ and ____ not ____ direct ____ government ____, ____ as ____, ____, ____, ____ local ____ goods ____. In return, they are expected to organize as many profitable ventures as possible and to turn over profits to the central government.
data.partBlankContent: In order to provide a certain degree of local autonomy as well as to lessen the financial burden of the central government, a "local budget system" was introduced in 1973. Under th__ system, provincial autho______ are respo______ for t__ operating co___ of instit______ and enter______ not un___ direct cen____ government con____, su__ as sch____, hosp_____, sh___, a__ local cons____ goods produ_____. In return, they are expected to organize as many profitable ventures as possible and to turn over profits to the central government.
data.fullContent: In order to provide a certain degree of local autonomy as well as to lessen the financial burden of the central government, a "local budget system" was introduced in 1973. Under this system, provincial authorities are responsible for the operating costs of institutions and enterprises not under direct central government control, such as schools, hospitals, shops, and local consumer goods production. In return, they are expected to organize as many profitable ventures as possible and to turn over profits to the central government.
data.answer: 为了提供一定程度的地方自治，同时减轻中央政府的财政负担，1973年开始实行“地方预算制度”。在该制度下，学校、医院、商店和当地消费品生产等不受中央直接控制的事业单位和企业的经营成本由省级主管部门负责。作为回报，他们要组织尽可能多的盈利企业，并将利润上交中央政府。
